actions.text: Referred to House Committee on The Judiciary.

actions.subcommittee: Courts, Civil Liberties, and the Administration of Justice
actions.text: Referred to Subcommittee on Courts, Civil Liberties, and the Administration of Justice.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Courts, Civil Liberties, and the Administration of Justice

official_title: A bill to prohibit the use of funds appropriated to the Legal Services Corporation for the implementation of regulations, guidelines, or other procedures that are more restrictive with respect to the determination of eligibility of clients than those in effect on January 1, 1983.

summary.text: States that funds appropriated to the Legal Services Corporation may not be used to implement regulations or procedures issued by the Corporation which would preclude eligibility for legal assistance for persons who would not have been excluded under Corporation regulations and procedures in effect on January 1, 1983.

titles.title: A bill to prohibit the use of funds appropriated to the Legal Services Corporation for the implementation of regulations, guidelines, or other procedures that are more restrictive with respect to the determination of eligibility of clients than those in effect on January 1, 1983.
